meanings.definition: The quality of being rude or impolite.
meanings.sent1: Her discourteousness towards the waiter upset everyone at the table.
meanings.sent2: His discourteousness was evident when he interrupted the speaker repeatedly.
meanings.sent3: The discourteousness of the character in the movie provided comic relief in an otherwise serious plot.
meanings.sent4: The discourteousness of the storm was evident in the way it knocked down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent5: The discourteousness of the driver cutting off others on the road was unforgettable.
meanings.sent6: Despite her discourteousness, she managed to make a good impression on her boss.
meanings.sent7: The discourteousness of the customer was evident in the way he spoke to the cashier.
meanings.sent8: The discourteousness of the dog barking loudly disturbed the neighbors.
meanings.sent9: His discourteousness towards his classmates made him unpopular in school.
meanings.sent10: The discourteousness of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: An act or behavior that lacks manners or consideration for others.
meanings.sent1: The discourteousness of talking loudly in a library can disturb others studying.
meanings.sent2: She showed her discourteousness by not saying thank you when someone held the door for her.
meanings.sent3: The discourteousness of cutting in line at the grocery store caused a commotion.
meanings.sent4: His discourteousness in not RSVPing to the invitation was disappointing.
meanings.sent5: The discourteousness of leaving trash behind at the park is unacceptable.
meanings.sent6: Despite his discourteousness, he managed to make a good impression on his colleagues.
meanings.sent7: The discourteousness of arriving late to the meeting was disrespectful.
meanings.sent8: The discourteousness of not acknowledging a gift received is impolite.
meanings.sent9: Her discourteousness towards the elderly lady shocked those around her.
meanings.sent10: The discourteousness of ignoring someone's message is inconsiderate.
